title: visualize.learning_curves() error
body:
When using ludwig-0.3.3 on Kaggle, I get this error when running `visualize.learning_curves([train_stats],None)`:

```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-f14b4201dd4f> in <module>
     25 
     26 from ludwig import visualize
---> 27 visualize.learning_curves([train_stats],None)

/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/visualize.py in learning_curves(train_stats_per_model, output_feature_name, model_names, output_directory, file_format, **kwargs)
   1283     output_feature_names = _validate_output_feature_name_from_train_stats(
   1284         output_feature_name,
-> 1285         train_stats_per_model_list
   1286     )
   1287 

/opt/conda/lib/python3.7/site-packages/ludwig/visualize.py in _validate_output_feature_name_from_train_stats(output_feature_name, train_stats_per_model)
    115     output_feature_names_set = set()
    116     for ls in train_stats_per_model:
--> 117         for _, values in ls.items():
    118             for key in values:
    119                 output_feature_names_set.add(key)

AttributeError: 'tuple' object has no attribute 'items'
```

This same code ran perfectly fine back in 2019 when using an older version of Ludwig. I haven't changed my code at all.
